database_info.title: Complete U.S. Transparency Laws Database
database_info.description: Comprehensive database of all 51 U.S. jurisdictions' transparency laws (FOIA/public records acts) validated against official government sources
database_info.validation_methodology: Two-step validation: (1) Download statute from official government website, (2) Cross-reference with recent legislative updates (2023-2025)
database_info.coverage: 100% of U.S. states plus District of Columbia

key_provisions.fees: Direct costs of duplication only
key_provisions.exemptions: Extensive exemptions in Gov. Code § 7927.700

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Confirmed current version, no pending changes identified

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable costs for copies and personnel time
key_provisions.exemptions: Detailed in Gov. Code § 552.101-552.147
key_provisions.enforcement: Mandamus suit or AG opinion request

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Current version verified, standard TPIA provisions confirmed

statute_info.statute_citation: New York Public Officers Law Article 6 (§§ 84-90)

key_provisions.fees: Actual reproduction costs
key_provisions.exemptions: Listed in Public Officers Law § 87(2)

cross_references: CRITICAL: S2520A pending - extends response times to 20 business days (up to 60-180 days with extensions) effective January 1, 2026
validation_metadata.validator_notes: MAJOR CHANGE PENDING: S2520A will significantly extend response times starting 1/1/2026

pending_changes.impact: Response time increases from 5 to 20 business days, with extensions up to 60-180 days

key_provisions.response_time: Reasonable time, typically within reasonable time
key_provisions.fees: Actual cost of duplication
key_provisions.exemptions: Extensive exemptions throughout Florida Statutes

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Current version confirmed, broad public access maintained

key_provisions.fees: Actual costs for copies over 50 pages
key_provisions.exemptions: Listed in 5 ILCS 140/7

cross_references: SB1445 (2023) - Enhanced disclosure requirements for certain records
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Recent amendments in SB1445 enhanced disclosure requirements

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable fees for duplication
key_provisions.exemptions: Listed in 65 Pa.C.S. § 708
key_provisions.enforcement: Appeal to agency, then OOR, then Commonwealth Court

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Current version verified with Office of Open Records structure

key_provisions.fees: Actual cost of making copies
key_provisions.exemptions: Listed throughout Ohio Revised Code
key_provisions.enforcement: Mandamus action in court of common pleas

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Current version confirmed, flexible response time maintained

key_provisions.response_time: Reasonable time during regular office hours
key_provisions.fees: Standard unit cost of duplication
key_provisions.exemptions: Security exemptions for critical infrastructure

cross_references: Security exemptions added for critical infrastructure
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Fragmented across multiple code sections rather than single comprehensive act

key_provisions.response_time: Reasonable rules during regular office hours
key_provisions.fees: Nominal cost, standard unit cost of duplication, hourly rate for searches exceeding 5 hours
key_provisions.exemptions: Presumption in favor of disclosure
key_provisions.enforcement: 60 days to appeal to agency head or superior court

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Strong presumption of access, liberal construction required

key_provisions.response_time: Promptly (proposed 5 business days in pending legislation)
key_provisions.fees: Copying costs, postage, hourly rate for searches over 1 hour
key_provisions.exemptions: Commercial use restrictions
key_provisions.enforcement: Superior court action, attorney fees available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Response time requirements under legislative review

key_provisions.response_time: Immediately if available, 3 working days if in storage
key_provisions.fees: Actual cost of reproduction, prepayment required over $25
key_provisions.exemptions: Arkansas citizens only, broad access rights
key_provisions.enforcement: Circuit court appeal, attorney fees available (not against state)

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Restricted to Arkansas citizens, strong access presumption

key_provisions.response_time: 3 working days (7 additional days if extenuating circumstances)
key_provisions.fees: $0.25 per page after first 25 pages, hourly rate after first hour
key_provisions.exemptions: Liberal construction for access
key_provisions.enforcement: District court action, discretionary attorney fees

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Fee waivers available for public purpose use

key_provisions.fees: $0.50 per page, $20 scanning fee, electronic delivery costs
key_provisions.exemptions: Broad public access with fee waiver provisions
key_provisions.enforcement: Freedom of Information Commission, court review available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Fee waivers for first $5 and indigent requesters

key_provisions.fees: First 20 pages free, $0.15 per page after for microfilm, labor fees allowed
key_provisions.exemptions: Delaware citizens only, FOIA coordinator required

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Restricted to Delaware citizens including corporate citizens

statute_info.primary_law: District of Columbia Freedom of Information Act

key_provisions.response_time: 15 business days (25 days for body worn camera footage)
key_provisions.fees: Search $16-$40/hour, first hour free, copying costs
key_provisions.exemptions: Fee waivers for public interest, 10-day extensions allowed

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Special provisions for body worn camera footage

key_provisions.fees: Search/retrieval fees, copying up to $0.10/page, prepayment required over $500
key_provisions.exemptions: Partial production required if some records available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Must notify if costs exceed $25, prepayment required over $500

key_provisions.fees: First page $0.50, additional pages $0.25, search fees allowed
key_provisions.exemptions: Automatic $60 public interest waiver

validation_metadata.validator_notes: 88% of state requests result in no fees charged

key_provisions.response_time: 3 working days (10 days for residents, 21 days for non-residents if extension needed)
key_provisions.fees: First 2 hours labor and 100 pages free, then actual costs
key_provisions.exemptions: Different response times for residents vs non-residents

cross_references: 2015 recodification under Transparent and Ethical Government
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Longer response times allowed for non-Idaho residents

key_provisions.response_time: 24 hours for in-person/phone requests, 7 days for mail/email (acknowledgment only)
key_provisions.fees: Up to $0.10/page copying, actual costs only, no labor fees
key_provisions.exemptions: No labor or overhead fees allowed
key_provisions.enforcement: Public Access Counselor, then court action

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Response time is for acknowledgment only, production in reasonable time

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable expenses, 30-minute rule for fee assessment
key_provisions.exemptions: 30-minute threshold before fees can be charged

cross_references: 2022 amendments limiting fees for requests under 30 minutes
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Recent changes limit fee assessment for simple requests

key_provisions.fees: Free for Kansas residents under 1 hour/$100 pages, then reasonable fees
key_provisions.exemptions: Free records for Kansas residents under threshold

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Special benefits for Kansas residents, various agency fee structures

key_provisions.response_time: 3 days (5 business days if records not readily available)
key_provisions.fees: Material costs for non-commercial use, staff time for commercial use
key_provisions.exemptions: Commercial vs non-commercial fee structure
key_provisions.enforcement: Circuit court action, attorney fees available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Different fee structure based on commercial use determination

key_provisions.response_time: Immediately if available, 3 business days if not immediately available
key_provisions.fees: Reasonable copying fees, advance payment allowed, fee waivers for indigent
key_provisions.exemptions: Exception must be asserted within 3 days
key_provisions.enforcement: District court action, attorney fees for prevailing party

validation_metadata.validator_notes: $100 per day penalty for custodians who arbitrarily refuse requests

key_provisions.response_time: 5 working days acknowledgment, reasonable time for production
key_provisions.fees: First 2 hours free, then $25/hour, $0.10/page copying
key_provisions.exemptions: Two-hour free search time, written denial required

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Acknowledgment required within 5 days, reasonable production time

statute_info.statute_citation: Md. Code Ann., Gen. Prov. §§ 4-101 to 4-601

key_provisions.response_time: 30 days maximum (10 business days initial response if delayed)
key_provisions.fees: First 2 hours free, then direct costs, $0.20/page standard copying
key_provisions.exemptions: 30-day extension possible, fee waivers available
key_provisions.enforcement: Public Access Ombudsman, then Compliance Board

validation_metadata.validator_notes: 20% of requests exceed 30-day deadline, ombudsman handles disputes

key_provisions.response_time: 10 business days (15 for state agencies, 25 for municipalities)
key_provisions.fees: Various fees by record type, $5 for accident reports, $1/page for crime reports
key_provisions.exemptions: Different timeframes for state vs municipal
key_provisions.enforcement: Supervisor of Records, then Superior Court

cross_references: Extensions up to 30 days for municipalities
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Longer response times allowed for municipalities vs state agencies

key_provisions.fees: Labor costs using lowest-paid capable employee rate, plus materials
key_provisions.exemptions: Extension requires written notice

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Labor costs limited to lowest-paid employee capable of performing work

key_provisions.response_time: Immediately or 10 business days for data subjects, reasonable time for others
key_provisions.fees: Inspection free, $0.25/page copying, actual search costs for summary data
key_provisions.exemptions: Different response times for data subjects vs general public
key_provisions.enforcement: Commissioner of Administration, then district court

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Tiered response system: immediate for data subjects, reasonable for others

key_provisions.response_time: 1 working day (up to 7 working days with procedures)
key_provisions.fees: Actual costs including search/review/duplication, lowest-level employee rate
key_provisions.exemptions: Ethics Commission complaint process

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Very fast response time, Ethics Commission oversight

key_provisions.fees: $0.10/page, research time at lowest clerical rate, no attorney fees
key_provisions.exemptions: Attorney fees prohibited for document review

cross_references: 2023 Gross v. Parson decision on attorney fees
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Recent court decision prohibits charging attorney fees for document review

key_provisions.fees: $0.10/page, 30 minutes free search time, then $8.50/hour
key_provisions.exemptions: Advance payment allowed, cost-efficient manner required

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Longer response time allowed, specific fee structure with free search time

key_provisions.fees: First 4 hours of search/redaction free, actual costs only
key_provisions.exemptions: Strict response time, 4-hour free labor threshold

validation_metadata.validator_notes: One of strictest response times in nation, generous free labor allowance

key_provisions.fees: Actual costs only (ink, toner, paper, media, postage), max $0.50/page
key_provisions.exemptions: Prohibits fees for searching, retrieving, or determining exemptions

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Strict limitation on allowable fees, no staff time charges permitted

statute_info.primary_law: New Hampshire Right to Know Law

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable fees for producing/reviewing/redacting, free for readily available records
key_provisions.exemptions: No fees for readily available records

validation_metadata.validator_notes: More flexible fee structure than Nevada, allows charges for redaction work

key_provisions.response_time: 7 business days (14 days for commercial requests)
key_provisions.fees: Standard copying fees, special service charges for extraordinary requests (>7 hours)
key_provisions.exemptions: Immediate access for certain records
key_provisions.enforcement: Government Records Council or Superior Court

cross_references: September 2024 commercial request timelines and fee changes
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Recent 2024 amendments created different timelines for commercial vs non-commercial

key_provisions.response_time: 3 business days notification, 15 days maximum for production
key_provisions.fees: Reasonable fees up to $1/page, no search fees allowed
key_provisions.exemptions: No search fees permitted, no fee waivers available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Prohibits search fees, maximum $1 per page for copying

key_provisions.response_time: As promptly as possible (no specific timeframe)
key_provisions.fees: Actual duplication costs, special service charges for extensive requests
key_provisions.exemptions: No specific response deadline, minimal cost policy

validation_metadata.validator_notes: No mandatory response deadline, flexible 'as promptly as possible' standard

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable fees for duplication, labor, and equipment use
key_provisions.exemptions: Attorney General oversight, reasonable time standard

validation_metadata.validator_notes: No specific response deadline, relies on reasonable time standard

key_provisions.fees: Max $0.25/page copying, $25/hour search fee (commercial/disruptive only)
key_provisions.exemptions: No search fees for public interest requests

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Search fees waived for news media, scholars, authors, and taxpayers

key_provisions.response_time: As soon as practicable and without unreasonable delay
key_provisions.fees: Actual costs including attorney review time, $25 notification threshold
key_provisions.exemptions: Attorney fees allowable for review/redaction

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Allows attorney time charges for redaction, no specific response deadline

key_provisions.fees: $0.15/page, first hour search free, then $15/hour max
key_provisions.exemptions: Deemed denial if no response in 10 days

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Clear fee structure with first hour free, automatic denial if no response

statute_info.primary_law: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act

key_provisions.response_time: 10 business days (20 days for records over 24 months old)
key_provisions.fees: Actual costs of search/retrieval/redaction, 25% deposit allowed
key_provisions.exemptions: Longer response time for older records

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Tiered response times based on record age, fee schedules must be posted online

key_provisions.fees: Actual costs of mailing/reproduction, first hour staff time free
key_provisions.exemptions: First hour of staff time provided free

validation_metadata.validator_notes: One of 11 states with no mandated response time, generous first-hour provision

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable costs for production, OORC fee schedule guidelines
key_provisions.exemptions: Office of Open Records Counsel oversight
key_provisions.enforcement: Office of Open Records Counsel, then court

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Specialized oversight office provides guidance and dispute resolution

statute_info.primary_law: Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA)

key_provisions.response_time: 10 business days (5 days for expedited/media requests)
key_provisions.fees: Actual costs, first 15 minutes free, no review fees
key_provisions.exemptions: Expedited process for media, presumption of public benefit for journalism
key_provisions.enforcement: State Records Committee, then district court

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Special expedited timeline for media requests, encourages public interest waivers

key_provisions.fees: Actual copying costs, staff time fees after 30 minutes
key_provisions.exemptions: Quick initial response time, 30-minute free staff time threshold

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Fast response requirement with reasonable extension provision

key_provisions.fees: Actual costs for access/duplication/searching, written fee policies required
key_provisions.exemptions: Written policies required for fees

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Clear extension process, emphasis on written fee policies

key_provisions.fees: Copying costs only: $0.15/page photocopy, $0.10/page scan, no search fees
key_provisions.exemptions: No fees for inspection or search

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Prohibits all search and retrieval fees, specific copying fee limits

statute_info.primary_law: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act

key_provisions.fees: Actual reproduction costs only, no search or retrieval fees
key_provisions.exemptions: Explicit prohibition on search/retrieval fees

validation_metadata.validator_notes: Clear prohibition on labor-based fees, limited to reproduction costs only

key_provisions.response_time: As soon as practicable and without delay
key_provisions.fees: Actual copying costs, location costs if over $50, computer programming fees
key_provisions.exemptions: $50 threshold for location fees
key_provisions.enforcement: Circuit court action, attorney fees available

validation_metadata.validator_notes: No specific deadline, emphasis on prompt response without delay

key_provisions.fees: Reasonable production costs, $180 threshold, hourly staff rates
key_provisions.exemptions: $180 fee threshold, tiered hourly rates by staff type

cross_references: Court concerns about variable fee structures
validation_metadata.validator_notes: Longest standard response time, significant fee threshold before charges apply

critical_alerts.description: S2520A will dramatically extend FOIL response times from 5 to 20 business days (with extensions up to 180 days) effective January 1, 2026

validation_summary.status: Complete national database of all U.S. transparency laws
